page.title: 10DULCOTE
page.content: The name derives from{Dultingcote,}the cottage/shelter by the Doulting River. (Doulting was the former name of the River Sheppey.) Dulcote is a{hamlet lying in the{Sheppey Valley,}on the {A371}between Wells And Shepton Mallet. It is situated between the Mendip ridge and Dulcote Hill. The hill's centre has been removed and its top lowered by quarrying, but this is not apparent from the village. Dulcote consists of about 30 houses built of local limestone and conglomerate. It remained unchanged for many years, but recently new, quite pleasant, houses have been built, partly from renovated farm outbuilding. There is a small mission{church (1860)}and a{fountain fed from Mendip groundwater. A mill chimney and a house remain from the former Sheppey Valley textile industry.
